N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 201.15 - Authorization to inter

State Regulations
(a) An
authorization to inter a body is a written statement subscribed by the lot
owner in accordance with the rules and regulations of the cemetery corporation. Such authorization when signed by the lot owner shall include the right to
memorialize, which right shall belong to the person having the right to
possession of the body. (b) The
right of memorialization may be restricted to the number, size, shape, material, color, inscription or reasonable placement of monuments, according to
the generally accepted plan of the cemetery and the rules and regulations of
the cemetery corporation or association duly approved by the Cemetery Board; and, where the lot is owned by a membership corporation, association or society
which provides burial benefits for its members, according to the rules, regulations or established practices of such corporation, association or
society. Notes
